intro: Annea afzelii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial shrub, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred shape. Annea afzelii thrives in moist, well-drained soil and requires partial shade to flourish.
